items.title: Kim Jong Un tests AI suicide drones for military modernization
items.summary:
- North Korean leader Kim Jong Un oversaw tests of AI-equipped suicide drones.
- State media emphasized the significance of unmanned systems and AI in arms development.
- Upgraded reconnaissance drones can detect tactical targets and monitor enemy activities.
- North Korea revealed an airborne early-warning aircraft for the first time.
- Kim highlighted the necessity of unmanned equipment and AI for military modernization.

items.title: Blibli posts 14% revenue growth in 2024
items.summary:
- Blibli reported a 14% year-on-year increase in consolidated net revenue for 2024, with a 41% surge in Q4.
- Direct sales business grew 66% to 859 billion rupiah (US$51.89 million) and marketplace sales rose 26%.
- Gross profit increased 173% year-on-year, and operational take rate rose to 6.9%.
- The company expanded its logistics network enabling two-hour delivery in 48 cities and operates 204 consumer electronics stores, 60 premium supermarkets, and 32 home and living centers.
- Initiatives supported by a 2.25 trillion rupiah (US$135.93 million) capital raise, reducing operating losses by 34%.

items.title: BYD targets 800k overseas EV sales by 2025
items.summary:
- BYD aims to double its overseas EV sales to over 800,000 units by 2025, announced by chairman Wang Chuanfu on Mar. 25.
- The company plans local vehicle assembly to mitigate tariff challenges while sourcing components from China.
- BYD is expanding in Latin America, Southeast Asia, and Britain, but will not enter the US or Canada due to tariffs.
- New factories are being constructed in Brazil, Thailand, Hungary, and Turkey.
- Overseas markets are expected to be a key driver for BYD's profitability, prompting a planned increase in its software team from 5,000 to 8,000 employees.

items.title: Ex-Intel CEO joins venture capital firm Playground Global
items.summary:
- Former Intel CEO, Brian Krzanich, has joined Playground Global, a venture capital firm focused on technology investments.
- Playground Global aims to support startups in hardware and AI sectors.
- Krzanich's experience in the tech industry is expected to enhance the firm's investment strategy.

items.title: Tesla stock drops 6% on Europe sales slump
items.summary:
- Tesla’s stock fell by 6% on Mar. 26, 2025, due to decreased sales in Europe and concerns over US auto tariffs.
- In February, Tesla experienced a 40% drop in new vehicle registrations in Europe while overall battery EV sales increased by 26%.
- The White House announced upcoming auto tariffs, which may impact foreign automakers.

items.title: Indian B2B ecommerce firm Jumbotail buys SC Ventures’ Solv India
items.summary:
- SC Ventures sells Solv India to Jumbotail, pending regulatory approvals.
- The merger aims to combine Jumbotail’s food and grocery ecommerce focus with Solv India’s apparel, home furnishings, footwear, and toys offerings.
- Jumbotail, established in 2015, provides ecommerce solutions for small retailers.
- Solv India, incubated in 2019, offers a digital commerce and supply chain finance platform for MSMEs.

items.title: Ticket resale firm StubHub omits co-founder in IPO filing
items.summary:
- StubHub filed for an IPO without mentioning its co-founder, Jeff Fluhr.
- The omission of Fluhr raises questions about his role and contributions to the company.
- StubHub is a major player in the ticket resale market, significantly impacting the industry.

items.title: Lazada ID co-founder’s healthtech startup raises $12m series B
items.author: Sundeep Sahni, Nadine Karadag, Ankur Majumder
items.summary:
- Valeo Health raises US$12 million in its series B funding round.
- Total funding for Valeo now reaches US$20 million.
- Series B led by Flintera; existing investors including Nuwa Capital, FJ Labs, Oryx, and Mindshift Capital, with new investors Oraseya and Eirad participating.
- Funds will be used to expand services in Saudi Arabia, UAE, and other GCC countries.
- Valeo provides AI-driven personalized healthcare and at-home services.

items.title: Chinese AI firm SenseTime posts $592m loss
items.summary:
- SenseTime Group Inc. reported a net loss of 4.3 billion yuan (US$592 million) for 2024, exceeding analyst estimates.
- Revenue grew by 11% to 3.8 billion yuan (US$523 million), driven by the generative AI segment, but fell short of the 4.5 billion yuan projected.
- The company plans to reduce costs related to large model training in anticipation of growth in large model applications.
- Recent developments include integrating DeepSeek into SenseCore and spinning off its AI medical unit.

items.title: D2C tea brand Vahdam India raises $3m
items.author: Bala Sarda
items.summary:
- Vahdam India raised 25 crore rupees (US$3 million) from SIDBI Venture Capital.
- The investment is stated to be 'strategic' and not part of a formal fundraising round.
- Founded in 2015, Vahdam sources tea from partner farmers across India and processes it locally.
- The company operates in international markets including the US, Canada, UK, and Europe through wholly owned subsidiaries.

items.title: Grab Malaysia partners with EV firms to boost driver adoption
items.summary:
- Grab Malaysia signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with BYD Sime Motors, Yinson Green Technologies (M), and Power-Up Tech to promote electric vehicle (EV) adoption among driver-partners.
- The initiative aims to provide accessible EV solutions and support Malaysia’s sustainability goals, including developing necessary charging infrastructure.
- BYD Sime Motors will offer exclusive car pricing and training, Yinson GreenTech will provide preferential leasing and charging rates, while Power-Up Tech will ensure reliable charging infrastructure through mobile charging facilities.

items.title: UAE-based AI startup Lumi bags $3.7m seed funding
items.author: Ibrahim Ashqar, Tudor Boiangiu
items.summary:
- Lumi AI, a UAE-based startup, raised $3.7 million in seed funding led by AgFunder, with investors including ADQ and Forum Ventures.
- This is Lumi AI's second funding round after an earlier investment in August 2023.
- Founded in April 2023, Lumi AI offers generative AI tools to help retail businesses digitize supply chains.
- The company plans to expand its conversational analytics platform and enhance its engineering and customer success teams.

items.title: X to grow ad revenue by 17.5% in 2025
items.summary:
- Elon Musk’s X (formerly Twitter) is projected to achieve a 17.5% increase in US advertising revenue in 2025, reaching US$1.31 billion.
- Global ad sales for 2025 are expected to rise 16.5% to US$2.26 billion.
- Despite this growth, X’s advertising revenue is significantly lower than the US$4.5 billion reported in 2021 before Musk's acquisition.

items.title: PayMongo partners with fintech firm Mochi for better billing
items.summary:
- PayMongo partners with Mochi to enhance payment and billing processes for businesses in the Philippines.
- Collaboration will integrate Mochi’s billing automation with PayMongo’s payment platform, simplifying financial operations.
- Digital payments in the Philippines predicted to exceed US$107 billion by 2025, highlighting the need for efficient financial tools.

items.title: Australian superannuation fund sells $580m stake in WiseTech
items.summary:
- AustralianSuper has divested its US$580 million stake in WiseTech Global due to governance concerns.
- The decision came after Richard White returned as executive chairman and four independent directors resigned, breaching ASX requirements.
- A review found White misled the company about personal relationships with employees and settled a dispute for US$2 million.
- Shares dropped over 30% post-resignation of directors but rose slightly to US$85.40 on Mar. 26.
- Other shareholders like Aware Super and HESTA, holding 2.5%, have expressed concerns and called for board changes.
- WiseTech has yet to comment on the divestment.

items.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook donates $4.1m to China’s top tech university
items.summary:
- Tim Cook announced a donation of 30 million yuan (US$4.1 million) to Zhejiang University during his visit to Hangzhou, China on Mar. 26, 2025.
- Zhejiang University is recognized as one of China's top institutions and has produced notable tech figures.
- The visit comes amid ongoing US-China tensions regarding trade and technology policies, following Cook's meeting with Chinese Premier Li Qiang in Beijing earlier that week.

items.title: Temasek-backed PsiQuantum hits $6b valuation
items.summary:
- PsiQuantum raises over US$750 million, increasing valuation to US$6 billion from US$3.15 billion in 2021.
- Australian government invests US$940 million as part of Future Made in Australia initiative.
- Company is developing a photonics-based quantum computer with a facility to be built in Brisbane, construction set to start in late 2025 and finish by 2027.
- BlackRock leads the funding round, joined by Baillie Gifford, Microsoft's M12, Temasek, and Blackbird Ventures.
- PsiQuantum is also building a quantum computer in Chicago with US$500 million in government incentives.

items.title: US EV maker Rivian launches micromobility-focused startup
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Rivian has launched a micromobility-focused startup called Also, raising US$105 million in funding from Eclipse Ventures.
- The startup aims to create smaller and more affordable EVs using Rivian's technology.
- Rivian retains a minority stake in Also, with CEO RJ Scaringe on its board and Chris Yu as president.
- Also plans to introduce its first product, resembling a bike, by next year in the US and Europe, with future expansion into Asia and South America.
- The concept originated from a skunkworks project at Rivian in 2019.

items.title: Michael Dell’s fund backs Israel’s Bank Leumi $77m tech fund
items.summary:
- Michael and Susan Dell’s investment fund has partnered with Bank Leumi for a US$77 million high-tech fund.
- The fund aims to finance companies developing cutting-edge technologies.
- Bank Leumi CEO Hanan Friedman highlighted strong foreign investor interest in Israel despite security tensions.
- The partnership underscores confidence in Israel’s innovation sector.
- Upcoming alignment of Israel’s trading days with global markets set for Jan. 1, 2026, initiated by the Bank of Israel and others.

items.title: Google Cloud, Thailand Stock Exchange launch AI tool
items.summary:
- The Stock Exchange of Thailand (SET) partners with Google Cloud to develop ATLAS, a generative AI-powered search tool.
- ATLAS, built on Google Cloud’s Vertex AI and Gemini 2.0 Flash model, allows streamlined information retrieval via a chat-based interface.
- Initially available to SET staff and listed companies, with plans to expand access to investors later.
- Enhances workflows in market intelligence, equity issuance, and market integrity monitoring, with future integration with BigQuery for real-time data processing.
- This initiative is part of SET’s efforts to modernize Thailand’s capital markets and improve stakeholder accessibility.

items.title: Vietnam approves SpaceX’s Starlink trial
items.summary:
- Vietnam has approved SpaceX to trial its Starlink satellite internet service until the end of 2030, as per a government statement on Mar. 26, 2025.
- The trial allows SpaceX to provide both fixed and mobile internet services across Vietnam, including connectivity for flights.
- A cap of 600,000 subscribers has been set for the trial period, with no restrictions on foreign ownership of the service.
- It is unclear if SpaceX has applied for a formal license to operate in Vietnam, and Starlink has not publicly commented on this approval.

items.title: Israeli tech sector raised $10b in 2024, grows in 2025
items.summary:
- Israeli tech sector raised over $10 billion in 2024, with exits reaching $13 billion.
- In January 2025, startups secured more than $620 million across 27 deals, a 30% increase from the previous year.
- Analysts predict strong valuations and potential IPO recovery, with ongoing global interest, particularly in cybersecurity.

items.title: Australian VC firm Microequities acquires 19% stake in edtech
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Australian Microequities Asset Management has acquired a 19% stake in Global IT Factory via its pre-IPO fund.
- Global IT Factory is a Melbourne-based curriculum management software provider with a 22% market share in Australia and New Zealand.
- This is Global IT Factory's first external investment since its founding a decade ago.
- The company plans to use the funds for product development and expansion into new markets.
- Financial details of the transaction were not disclosed.

items.title: Defense tech firm Anduril expands manufacturing in Australia
items.summary:
- Anduril Industries is expanding its manufacturing operations internationally, including in Australia.
- A production site is being developed in New South Wales to support the Australian Defence Force.
- The company is also building a mass manufacturing facility in Ohio.
- Anduril partnered with OpenAI for integrating advanced AI into national security systems.
- They are working on the Ghost Shark, an autonomous underwater system, with updates on production expected soon.
- Company president Christian Bose commented on uncertainties regarding proposed US defense budget reductions and reallocations.

items.title: US adds 80 firms to blacklist, over 50 from China
items.summary:
- The US has added 80 organizations to its export blacklist to prevent China from acquiring advanced computing technologies for military use.
- Over 50 of the entities are based in China, with others located in Iran, Taiwan, Pakistan, South Africa, and the UAE.
- The restrictions target technologies like high-performance computing, AI, quantum technologies, and hypersonic weapons development.
- Six subsidiaries of Inspur Group, a major Chinese cloud provider, were blacklisted for aiding Chinese military supercomputers.
- China's Foreign Ministry condemned the action as a violation of international law, reflecting ongoing US-China tensions over trade disputes.

items.title: OpenAI expects to be cash flow positive by 2029
items.summary:
- OpenAI does not expect to achieve positive cash flow until 2029 due to high costs.
- The company anticipates revenue exceeding US$125 billion by 2029.
- Projected revenue for 2025 is US$12.7 billion, up from US$3.7 billion in 2024.
- Recent developments include enhancements to GPT-4o and ChatGPT's voice mode, and partnerships with SoftBank and Oracle.

items.title: US video game retailer GameStop jumps 12% on bitcoin investment
items.summary:
- GameStop’s stock increased by 12% on March 26 after announcing its bitcoin investment.
- This move aligns GameStop with firms like Strategy, which is the largest corporate holder of bitcoin.
- Stock movement is now linked to the company's cryptocurrency venture rather than retail operations.
- Bitcoin is currently trading around US$88,000, after hitting an all-time high earlier this year.
- Analysts caution about potential volatility in GameStop's stock due to its exposure to the crypto market.
- Despite reporting a net income of US$131.3 million in Q4, GameStop's net sales fell by 30% to US$1.28 billion as the company shifts towards ecommerce under CEO Ryan Cohen.

items.title: Oddle trims staff in AI push, targets profits in 2025
items.summary:
- Oddle, a Singapore-based restaurant software startup, has laid off slightly over 10 employees in two rounds this year as it transitions to an AI-first company.
- In April 2023, the company had previously laid off 25% of its staff.
- Oddle aims to turn profitable by 2025, focusing on AI to optimize sales and productivity, despite reporting a loss of S$9.2 million in 2023, down from higher losses in the previous year.
- The company operates in Singapore, Malaysia, Hong Kong, and Taiwan, competing with food delivery services like GrabFood and Foodpanda.

items.title: Israeli construction tech startup enhances excavation safety
items.author: Moshe Dalman, Yossi Gershon
items.summary:
- RodRadar has developed Live Dig Radar (LDR) for excavation safety.
- The system provides real-time alerts on buried infrastructure.
- Founded in 2013, it has raised US$20 million and employs 30 people.
- Recent funding round led by Brick and Mortar Ventures with Dysraptek and the Meir Group participating.

items.title: Who’s investing in India’s fintech startups?
ASEAN tech funding faces gaps despite recovery signs: report
items.summary:
- A report reveals significant funding gaps in Southeast Asia's tech investment landscape despite signs of stabilization.
- Total invested capital declined 18% year-on-year, with deal count down 23% in 2024.
- AI sector remains underfunded, with software and AI deals dropping 50% since 2022.
- Seed-stage funding struggles, with series A investments three times higher than seed-stage funding.
- 72% of pre-seed and seed founders rate fundraising conditions as poor.
- Without dedicated seed and AI capital, the region risks losing talent and stifling growth.
- The report stresses the need to address these gaps for long-term innovation in ASEAN.

items.title: Tesla to launch EVs in Saudi Arabia
items.summary:
- Tesla plans to launch its electric vehicles in Saudi Arabia, starting with an event on Apr. 10.
- The event will showcase Tesla's EV lineup, including demonstrations of its Cybercab autonomous technology and Optimus humanoid robot.
- Electric vehicles currently account for just over 1% of car sales in Saudi Arabia, presenting a challenge for Tesla.

items.title: Israeli cybersecurity startup Island nets $250m series E
Farm-fresh startup Country Delight raises $25m from Temasek
items.summary:
- Country Delight, a farm-fresh startup, has raised $25 million from Temasek.
- The investment aims to expand its presence in the fresh food market.
- This funding round highlights growing interest in technology-driven agricultural solutions.

items.title: US-based 2am VC targets India’s Gen Z with new $25m fund
items.author: Hershel Mehta, Brendan Rogers
items.summary:
- 2am VC has launched a US$25 million second fund, focusing on investments in Indian startups.
- The fund aims to back up to 30 startups at pre-seed to seed stages, with investments ranging from US$500,000 to US$1 million.
- Targeting Generation Z consumers, Fund II will explore sectors such as food, fashion, gaming, finance, and AI.
- The firm’s first fund backed 49 companies, with notable successes like NewMe and Apna Mart.
- 2am VC is backed by tech executives from companies like Apple, DoorDash, and Meta, and aims to be the connecting link for Silicon Valley to early-stage Indian startups.

items.title: Meesho reports profitability in FY24
items.summary:
- Indian e-commerce platform Meesho reports profitability for FY24, marking a milestone for horizontal e-commerce in India.
- Achieved positive free cash flow of 197 crore rupees (US$23.64 million) and reduced adjusted losses by 97% to 53 crore rupees (US$6.36 million).
- Approximately 187 million annual transacting users with 1.3 billion orders placed between April and December 2024.

items.title: Southeast Asian startups that raised funds over 18 months ago
items.summary:
- Startups with at least 18 months of runway are analyzed.
- List compiled by Tech in Asia includes startups that last raised funds 18 months to 3 years ago.
- Possible scenarios: startups thriving without need for new capital, reducing burn rates, or facing challenges in fundraising.
- Inclusion on the list does not inherently reflect the health of the business.
- Inaccuracies can be reported to research@techinasia.com.

items.title: IPhone 16 to be available in Indonesia from Apr. 11
PE jumps on Japan’s HR tech boom
items.summary:
- Private equity (PE) firms are making numerous acquisitions in Japan's HR tech sector.
- Factors driving PE interest include low interest rates, market restructuring, and a growing focus on governance.
- Japan's HR tech market is fragmented, and banks are increasingly focused on talent management.
- New challengers are emerging as global firms enter the market.
- Fierce competition may create a 'race to the bottom' for market share among well-funded players.

items.title: China’s Vivo unveils robotics lab, mixed reality headset
items.summary:
- Vivo presented innovations in robotics and mixed reality technology at the [Boao Forum for Asia Annual Conference 2025](https://www.techinasia.com/news/chinas-vivo-unveils-robotics-lab-mixed-reality-headset) on Mar. 25.
- The company established a robotics laboratory for developing consumer and home robotics technology using AI, imaging technologies, and spatial computing.
- Vivo unveiled a mixed reality headset named the Vivo Vision.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Israel’s startups
Alipay+ goes live in Sri Lanka
items.summary:
- Ant International and LankaPay launch cross-border mobile payments via the LankaQR network.
- 14 international payment apps under Alipay+ can be used at over 400,000 Sri Lankan merchants.
- Travelers from 10 countries, including China, South Korea, and Italy, can use their digital wallets to pay by scanning QR codes.
- The initiative aims to simplify payments for tourists and boost local business.
- Partner apps include Alipay, GCash, and Naver Pay, among others.
- The LankaQR network was introduced by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka in 2020 for QR-based transaction interoperability.

items.title: Amazon tests AI tools for shopping, health assistance
items.summary:
- Amazon is currently testing AI tools to enhance shopping experiences.
- The tools may also assist customers in health-related queries.
- This initiative aims to leverage AI for improving customer service and engagement.

items.title: Grab Indonesia launches new feature for easier bill payments
items.summary:
- Grab Indonesia has introduced a new feature to streamline the bill payment process for users.
- The feature aims to enhance user experience by making it more convenient to pay bills through the app.
- This initiative is part of Grab's ongoing efforts to expand its financial services in the region.

items.title: Bain Capital acquires majority stake in Italian software firm
items.summary:
- Bain Capital is acquiring a majority stake in Italian software company Namirial SpA from Ambienta.
- The deal values Namirial at €1.1 billion (US$1.2 billion).
- Namirial's founder and CEO, along with the management, will retain a significant stake in the company.
- The transaction will be officially announced this week.

items.title: BharatPe hits EBITDA breakeven, cuts losses in FY25
items.summary:
- BharatPe reported EBITDA breakeven for the first nine months of FY25.
- Consolidated net loss improved to 149 crore rupee (US$17.37 million) from 492 crore rupee (US$57.37 million) in FY24.
- The company's NBFC arm, Trillion Loans Fintech, made a profit of 29.7 crore rupee (US$3.46 million).
- Revenue grew 182% in FY23, reaching 1,029 crore rupee (US$119.99 million) under interim CEO Nalin Negi.
- The financial turnaround followed internal disputes involving former MD Ashneer Grover.

items.title: US AI fintech Sympera AI secures $10m seed funding
items.author: David Sosna, Daniel Gordon
items.summary:
- Sympera AI, a fintech startup, raised US$10 million in seed funding led by Nyca Partners and Viola Ventures.
- The company aims to improve relationship banking for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) using AI.
- The platform uses AI agents to assist relationship managers in identifying business opportunities for SMBs, addressing inefficiencies in resource allocation.
- SMBs contribute approximately US$150 billion annually to US banking revenue.
- The funding reflects growing interest in AI-driven financial solutions as banks work to enhance efficiency and personalize client interactions.

items.title: WeLab banks on SEA for growth
items.author: Miguel
items.summary:
- WeLab Bank is expanding into the Philippines, Malaysia, and Vietnam after achieving monthly breakeven in December 2024.
- The bank aims for profitability in Indonesia and Thailand within three to five years.
- Founder Simon Loong reflects on the irony of returning to banking after leaving a traditional bank.

items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s SaaS startups?
items.summary:
- Overview of active investors in Southeast Asia's software-as-a-service (SaaS) sector.
- Features an updated list of investors that backed region's SaaS startups in the last two years.
- Focuses on firms that have invested in three or more companies within the specified timeframe.

items.title: Grab seeks $2b loan for potential GoTo acquisition, sources say
items.summary:
- Grab Holdings Ltd. is in discussions for a loan of up to US$2 billion to acquire GoTo Group Inc.
- The proposed bridge loan would have a term of about 12 months.
- Talks are in early stages, details may evolve. 
- Grab is also considering other financing options, such as bonds or equity, depending on the acquisition's success.
